newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY-GAUTENG HUMBLE HAPLESS NATAL.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY-GAUTENG HUMBLE HAPLESS NATAL.

text.p: Gauteng Lions,(formerly Transvaal, finished fifth in the Super 12 standings thanks to a rousing conclusion to their campaign at Ellis Park where they humbled semi finalists Natal 42-8 (half time 16-3).
The Lions put behind them a miserable antipodean campaign, which saw them gain just one point from four matches, with a five- try display of confident rugby.
Fullback Dawie du Toit scored twice, either side of half time after an initial kicking duel between Gavin Lawless and Edrich Lubbe had seen the latter lift his team to 9-3 in the 39th minute.

Du Toit's second try, five minutes into second half gave Gauteng a 20-point lead and they never looked back. Scrumhalf Jopie Adlam capped a livewire display with his team's third try nine minutes later, diving over from the base of a ruck.

Natal defended indifferently therefter and replacement wing Joe Gillingham sidestepped three tacklers to score in the 65th minute, while centre Jannie van der Walt finished a sweeping movement on the left three minutes later.
Natal left wing Cabous van der Westhuizen scored a consolation try in the dying minutes, put clear by a perfectly judged pass from replacement fullback Andre Joubert.

Springbok Joubert's first appearance of the season following a knee operation was the one crumb of comfort for the visitors, who now face the daunting task of taking on Auckland at Eden Park in the semi-final next week.

Auckland were comprehensive 39-17 victors in the log match at the same venue and with Natal looking a shadow of the side which began the tournament it will take a huge improvement for them to even be competitive next week.

Gauteng Lions - Dawie du Toit; F.P.Naude, Jannie van der Walt, Edrich Lubbe, Pieter Hendriks (Joe Gillingham 60 mins); Louis van Rensburg, Jopie Adlam; Warren Brosnihan, Piet Krause, Andre Vos, Hannes Strydom (captain), Bruce Thorne, Kapstok van Greunng, Chris Rossouw, Roberto Grau.

Natal - Gavin Lawless (Andre Joubert 40 mins); Joos Joubert, Jeremy Thomson (Geoff Appleford 69 mins), Errol Stewart, Cabous van der Westhuizen; Jaco van der Westhuyzen, Robert du Preez; Dieter Kriese, Wayne Fyvie, Walter Minnaar, Ryan Strudwick, John Slade (Wayne Boardman 62 mins), Robbie Kempson, Danie van der Walt, Ollie le Roux.
